title: SecureMail
description: A privacy-focused email service offering end-to-end encryption and secure storage.
introduction: In an era where digital privacy is under constant threat, SecureMail was conceived to provide a reliable and secure communication platform. By prioritizing end-to-end encryption and robust storage solutions, SecureMail aims to empower users with control over their data and communications.

sections.title: Motivation
sections.body: The motivation behind SecureMail stemmed from the growing need for privacy in digital communications. Traditional email services often lack true end-to-end encryption, leaving users vulnerable to data breaches. SecureMail was designed to address this gap by providing a platform where users can send and receive emails with confidence in their security.

sections.title: Challenges
sections.body: One of the primary challenges was implementing end-to-end encryption without compromising user experience. We also faced hurdles in ensuring compatibility across different email clients and devices. To overcome these, we developed a custom encryption protocol and a unified API for seamless integration.

sections.title: Development Process
sections.body: The development process involved selecting the right technologies to ensure both security and performance. We chose React for the frontend to create an intuitive user interface and Node.js for the backend to handle encrypted communications. We also implemented a zero-knowledge proof system to ensure that only senders and receivers can access email content.

sections.title: Current Features
sections.body: SecureMail currently offers end-to-end encryption for all communications, secure cloud storage with client-side encryption, and two-factor authentication for added security. The platform also includes features like encrypted contact management and real-time notifications for new emails.

sections.title: Future Plans
sections.body: Our roadmap includes integrating AI-driven spam filtering, enhancing the user interface for better accessibility, and expanding support for custom domains. We also plan to introduce a mobile app version of SecureMail to ensure users can stay secure on the go.
